clinical_study.brief_title: Simultaneous Injection of Propofol and Rocuronium in Inducing General Anesthesia
clinical_study.official_title: Efficacy of Neuromuscular Blockade Before Facemask Ventilation in Inducing General Anesthesia

brief_summary.textblock: This study is conducted to evaluate the efficacy of simultaneous injection of propofol and rocuronium in inducing general anesthesia.

primary_outcome.time_frame: from starting facemask ventilation for 1 minute
primary_outcome.description: mean tidal volume of facemask ventilation in 1 minute

arm_group.arm_group_label: simultaneous administration of propofol and rocuronium
arm_group.description: In this group, the investigator will administrate propofol (2ml/kg) and rocuronium (0.6mg/kg) simultaneously, and start facemask ventilation after patient loss consciousness to induce general anesthesia. The investigator will measure the mean tidal volume (TV) applied during facemask ventilation for 1 minute.

arm_group.arm_group_label: ordinal administration of propofol and rocuronium
arm_group.description: In this group, the investigator will administrate propofol (2ml/kg) first, and follow injection of rocuronium (0.6mg/kg) after patient loss consciousness and confirming facemask ventilation. The investigator will measure the mean tidal volume (TV) applied during facemask ventilation for 1 minute.

intervention.description: compare the tidal volume applied from starting facemask ventilation under 15cmH2O of PCV for 1 minute according to administrating propofol and rocuronium simultaneously, or ordinally
intervention.arm_group_label: simultaneous administration of propofol and rocuronium
ordinal administration of propofol and rocuronium

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- patients undergoing elective surgery requiring endotracheal intubation
- ASA I, II, and III
- above 20 years
Exclusion Criteria:
- refuse to enroll
- patients with risk of aspirating gastric contents
- patients in whom NMBs are contraindicated
- patients with predictors of difficult mask ventilation
